intro: Physaria occidentalis var. goodrichii, commonly known as the Goodrich's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, inflated pods that resemble bladders. Its flowers are small and yellow, typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. The species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
